intro: Strobilanthes sulawesiana, commonly known as the Sulawesi flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often near streams or in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while its flowers emit a mild fragrance. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
